job.name: Stress_Testing_Monte_Carlo_Value_Portfolio_MC_Interactive_Control

variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM
variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.

variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED
variable.description: If True, it will activate the use of GPU for the workflow tasks on the selected container platform.

variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE
variable.description: Name of the container image being used to run the workflow tasks.

variable.name: nb_MC_per_ptf_value
variable.description: The number of Monte Carlo simulations per portfolio estimation.

variable.name: nb_time_steps
variable.description: The number of time steps to the horizon.

variable.name: stress_horizon
variable.description: The stress horizon in year fraction.

variable.name: assets_params_file_path_from_dataspace
variable.description: The relative path from the dataspace of the asset params file following the csv format.

variable.name: assets_correlations_file_path_from_dataspace
variable.description: The relative path from the dataspace of the asset correlations file.

variable.name: stressed_risk_free_rate_min_max_in_percent_and_steps
variable.description: The min, max, step of the stressed risk free rate range.

variable.name: stressed_volatility_min_max_in_percent_and_steps
variable.description: The min, max, step of the stressed volatility rate range.

variable.name: nb_replicated_tasks
variable.description: The number of ProActive replicated tasks which must divide the risk free rate step number x the volatility step number. These latter are deduced from stressed_risk_free_rate_min_max_in_percent_and_steps and stressed_volatility_min_max_in_percent_and_steps respectively.

variable.name: DOCKER_ENABLED
variable.description: If true, the workflow tasks will be executed inside a docker container

variable.name: VISDOM_INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: Name of the Visdom service instance to use.

variable.name: VISDOM_PROXYFIED
variable.description: If True, requests to Visdom are sent via a proxy server.

variable.name: VISDOM_ENABLE_LOGIN
variable.description: If True, a login in required for accessing the Visdom service.

variable.name: VISDOM_USERNAME
variable.description: Username to access the Visdom service.

variable.name: VISDOM_PASSWORD
variable.description: Password to access the Visdom service.

job.description: Portfolio Stress-Testing according to user ranges of values. After the stress testing, user can rerun/trigger more simualations to improve the stressed portfolio estimations.

variable.name: DOCKER_ENABLED
variable.description: If true, the workflow tasks will be executed inside a docker container

variable.name: DOCKER_IMAGE
variable.description: Name of the docker image

script.code:
import numpy as np import pandas as pd from visdom import Visdom
##### CONNECT TO VISDOM #####
visdom_endpoint = variables.get("ENDPOINT_VISDOM") if variables.get("ENDPOINT_VISDOM") else results[0].__str__() print("VISDOM_ENDPOINT: ", visdom_endpoint)
assert visdom_endpoint is not None
visdom_endpoint = visdom_endpoint.replace("http://", "")
(VISDOM_HOST, VISDOM_PORT) = visdom_endpoint.split(":")
print("Connecting to %s:%s" % (VISDOM_HOST, VISDOM_PORT)) vis = Visdom(server="http://"+VISDOM_HOST, port=int(VISDOM_PORT)) assert vis.check_connection()
##### PLOT #####
# Labels stressed_risk_free_rate_in_percent_label = 'stressed risk free rate (%)' stressed_volatility_in_percent_label = 'stressed volatility (%)' expected_PnL_label = 'Ptf PnL' nb_MC_label = 'nb_MC'
# Read data job_id = variables.get("PA_JOB_ID") df = pd.read_csv('stressed_PnLs_job_' + job_id + '.csv', sep=' ')
# Plot text textwindow = vis.text('Stressed Portfolio P&Ls (Profit and Loss)') vis.text('1 point = 1 P&L', win=textwindow, append=True) vis.text('Nb MC simus per P&L: ' + str(df[nb_MC_label][0]), win=textwindow, append=True) vis.text('X: ' + stressed_risk_free_rate_in_percent_label, win=textwindow, append=True) vis.text('Y: ' + stressed_volatility_in_percent_label, win=textwindow, append=True) vis.text('Z: ' + expected_PnL_label, win=textwindow, append=True)
# Plot data df = df[df.columns[:-1]] df_arr = df.to_numpy() print(df_arr) vis.scatter(df_arr, opts=dict( markersize=5 ))
# Put signal for interactive control variables.put("waitForSignals", True)

task.name: Wait_For_Signals_With_Variables
task.description: A template task that sends a ready notification for all the signals specified in the variable SIGNALS, then loops until one signal among those specified is received by the job.

variable.name: SIGNALS
variable.description: List of comma-separated signals expected by this task.

task.name: Rerun_Simulation
task.description: A template task that waits for a Signal with variables, allowing to rerun the loop with new variable values.

task.name: Start_Visdom_Service
task.description: Start the Visdom server as a service.

variable.name: SERVICE_ACTIVATION_WORKFLOW
variable.description: The service activation workflow. Please keep the default value for this variable.

variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: Instance name of the server to be used to broadcast the visualization.

variable.name: ENGINE
variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.

variable.name: PROXYFIED
variable.description: If True, requests to Visdom are sent via a proxy server.

task.name: Visdom_Service_Actions
task.description: This task manages the life-cycle of Visdom PSA service. It allows to trigger the following actions: Finish_Visdom. It requires the following variables: INSTANCE_ID: if used alone or; INSTANCE_NAME: if used within the same workflow as a Visdom_Service_Start task. In this case there is no need for an INSTANCE_ID. ACTION: the action to execute on the Visdom service among the aforementioned actions.

variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME
variable.description: Instance name of the server to be used to broadcast the visualization.

variable.name: SERVICE_ACTION_WORKFLOW
variable.description: The action that will be processed regarding the service status.

variable.name: INSTANCE_ID
variable.description: Visdom instance ID to be used.
